title: 111_hr6444
content: The Act is titled "No Health Care Subsidies for Illegal Aliens Act of 2010" and outlines procedures for eligibility determinations under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include requirements for in-person attestation of citizenship or lawful permanent resident status. The Secretary must ensure eligibility determinations are conducted according to the new verification process. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include requirements for in-person attestation of citizenship or lawful permanent resident status, along with a sworn statement under penalty of perjury. This is to ensure eligibility for coverage under a qualified health plan offered through an Exchange. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to require evidence of citizenship or nationality and satisfactory immigration status for enrollees seeking coverage under a qualified health plan. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act now requires proof of citizenship or nationality and satisfactory immigration status for enrollees applying for coverage under a qualified health plan. Verification of eligibility is done through documentation provided by the exchange. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act mandates verification of citizenship, nationality, and immigration status for health plan enrollees. Exchanges must verify eligibility through documentation provided by applicants. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act requires Exchanges to verify citizenship, nationality, and immigration status of health plan enrollees through documentation provided by applicants. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act requires Exchanges to verify citizenship, nationality, and immigration status of health plan enrollees through documentation provided by applicants. Section 1411 of the Act is amended to include documentation requirements and eliminate secretarial authority to modify verification methods. Section 1411 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to include documentation requirements for verifying citizenship, nationality, and immigration status of health plan enrollees. Secretarial authority to modify verification methods is eliminated, and inconsistencies are addressed through the existing secondary verification process. The existing secondary verification process under Section 1411(d)(3) of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to align with the process established in accordance with section 1137 of the Social Security Act. The amendments made by this Act will be effective as if they were part of the original Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act enactment.
